Hello, thanks for visiting!

I am a fifth year Software Engineering doctoral student at CMU S3D advised by Professor Haiyi Zhu from the Human Computer Interaction Institute , where I research ways alleviating negative impacts of algorithmically managed work. To tackle the complex issues of gig work, I leverage design and empirical methods engage to with multiple stakeholder groups, so as to develop policy and technology innovations that engender more equitable, empowered, and sustainable futures for platform-based laborers.

Beyond research, I serve as a TA for Human-AI Interaction course last fall and am generously funded by the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship in 2021.

In 2020, I graduated Oberlin College with a BA in CS and Math (along with a Cognitive Science concentration), where I was advised academically by Bob Geitz and Bob Bosch, and research-wise by Cynthia Tayler and Yumi Ijiri.
